name: Citicoline
summary: A neuroprotective and cognitive-enhancing supplement used for stroke recovery, memory disorders, and other neurological conditions.
description: Citicoline (cytidine-5'-diphosphocholine, CDP-choline) is a naturally occurring compound involved in phospholipid synthesis. It is used as a dietary supplement and in some countries as a prescription medication for cognitive impairment, stroke recovery, and traumatic brain injury. Citicoline may enhance neuronal membrane repair, improve acetylcholine synthesis, and support mitochondrial function. While evidence supports its use in certain neurological conditions, results are mixed in dementia and general cognitive enhancement.

metadata.prescription_status: OTC in many countries, prescription in some

sections.text: Citicoline provides choline for acetylcholine synthesis and cytidine for membrane phospholipid synthesis, supporting neuronal membrane repair and function. It may also enhance neuroplasticity and cerebral metabolism.

sections.geriatric: Same as adult dosing; adjust for tolerability

items: IV injection (prescription form in some countries)

sections.text: Effects on cognition may take weeks to months; benefits in acute stroke or TBI may be seen sooner.

other: Monitor for insomnia if taken late in the day

sections.pregnancy: Insufficient data; use only if clearly needed
sections.lactation: Unknown excretion in human milk; caution advised
sections.pediatrics: Limited data; sometimes used in cerebral palsy

sections.text: No taper generally required; may discontinue abruptly without withdrawal.

items: Evidence strongest for use in acute ischemic stroke and vascular dementia
Often used as a dietary supplement in the US
